doc.title: Westhope: Above and Below
doc.plot: As wars in the Middle East, rising gas prices, and the search for alternative fuels transform American life, Westhope, North Dakota, rides the tail end of an oil boom. Rigs pepper the harsh prairie surrounding the town. But while drilling depletes this non-renewable resource, my family and other descendants of Midwestern farmers-turned-driller, face the challenge of a dwindling livelihood. Fifty years after the discovery of oil, Westhope residents live in the tension between crude and agriculture, between -pump and harvest. As the oil slows, farmers begin to plant sunflowers, canola and other bio-diesel crops. Focusing on the effect of the energy crisis on the domestic lives of Americans, I strive to engage the viewer in the discussion and debate that surrounds these important issues.
